newsitem.title: GERMANY: German department stores suffer weak Christmas.
newsitem.headline: German department stores suffer weak Christmas.

text.p: Germany's department stores suffered a poor Christmas, with sales down in December by 3.4 percent on a year earlier, and turnover down for 1996 as a whole by 1.2 percent, the BGA lobby group said on Monday.

December business, on a same-store basis, was down by four percent. The Christmas season drew large crowds of shoppers, but they were reluctant to spend, said a spokesman for the BGA, a trade group of bigger shops.
Sales at store chains Karstadt, Hertie, the Metro group's Kaufhof and Horten Galeria were also down 1.2 percent for the year on a same-store basis.
The year-end sales slump came despite the loosening of a decades-old shop hours law in November, adding 90 minutes to weekday shopping and two extra hours on Saturdays.
